channel.title: Flight simulator X
channel.description:
Hey on my new laptop I tried plugging in a second monitor and to my amazement I now have dual screens so i thought "Omg i should so try flight simulator now that i have dual monitors" and so i went up to my old room and found the old FSX that I bought on a whim. I installed it and joined an online server called "gatwick atc" because Gatwick is my nearest major airport. It was so awesome playing because it was so realistic having an air traffic controller ordering all of us about. I found it really fun also having 2 screens locked on my aircraft.
So does anyone else play flight simulators?

item.title: Flight simulator X
item.dc:creator: @ninja_nub ninja nub
item.description:
@ninja_nub wrote:

Well, someone keeps logging on my gamespy account, so I’ll create another. Well, tell me your username and we can all fly ^^

TBH I’m only somewhat good. I’m not like ‘LYK AMG HOW I TAKE OFF AND TURN, THIS BORING FAK THIS I PLAY RS2’

Read full topic

item.title: Flight simulator X
item.dc:creator: @eclipse245 eclipse245
item.description:
@eclipse245 wrote:

Yes, I am Professional Flight Simulator Pilot. Me and my buddies fly learjets - 747’s usually around 10 hours on weekends. Quite fun because me make many “Re-fuels” on our way to our destination. Last weekend we flew CYYZ to KLAX, very nice flight with real weather. Also I spent over $200 on FSX add-ons. My favorite is Captain-Sim 757, and Flight Deck 4.

Read full topic

item.title: Flight simulator X
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:26, topic:149575”][quote author=cooper link=topic=204956.msg1903564#msg1903564 date=1196296969]
Oh okay, I am still somewhat confused between the differences you say though, how is playing with others different from playing with the computer controlled planes?
[/quote]
because its fun to fly with other people whom you can actually hear on the radio.
Its also fun to be talking to a real person air traffic controller.[/quote]
Oh okay, I see. I really should get a joystick so I am better at this game.

Read full topic

Hmm, whats the point of playing online? How is it different from free flight? I’ve tried it but I didn’t do it much… also where could I get a good cheap joystick, and do any of you have recommendations?

The experience of playing with other people and being an actual ATCer

item.title: Flight simulator X
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

jme_009:

I played some of the begginer missions and I flew from the nearest air port to my city. After that I really couldn’t tolerate that game anymore so I deleted. It was like 13 gb’s installed too lol.

I can understand why you got bored, playing the missions and training things are really quite boring, the only real fun they possess is getting all of them complete…

But what i’m saying is that you should try flying online, its a lot more fun with other people.

Read full topic

item.title: Flight simulator X
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Yes this flight simulating is addicting, i just played about 3 hours non stop, I just completed my first successful flight from New York(kennedy international) to Gatwick and everything went great (took about 3 and a half hours in my f-16 fighter).
It was also my first landing in the dark which I’m quite proud of.

Read full topic
